job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Flexible Hours, Interesting Work, Great Experience
cons: There aren't a lot of cons. Mainly salary

pros:
* Good benefits / some cool perks 
* Most of the staff is really nice 
* Some centers/areas are really laidback
* Nice restaurants and in a cool area of Phoenix 
* Building is really beautiful
cons:
* There are double standards and inconsistencies regarding who is/is not allowed to work from home. When I was offered the position, I was told I could WFH one day a week (once I was settled) but I did not find out until I requested to start this how many steps of approval it needed to go through before going into effect and that it could take weeks or even months to happen. 
* Some directors are big micro-managers, you're expected to be at your desk working all day even if you're able to get the work done well in less time - I had to tell my manager if I was leaving my desk to take a quick break 
* Pay does not make the often toxic work culture worth it, especially if you're commuting and having to deal with fuel prices or other high personal expenses - I experienced bullying 
* Faculty is treated like royalty by the university and they all fail to realize that it's the staff that does most of the difficult and/or boring behind the scenes work - if you work somewhere that faculty are involved, they WILL treat you like their personal assistant on top of your actual job
* Not a lot of direction or opportunities to learn/grow or job advancement - seems to be mostly lateral moves 
* Unsupportive of mental health needs that are being impacted and/or impacting ability to work
* When I quit I offered to have a chat with my manager and/or HR regarding my decision to leave and in response, they deleted my account without another word and would not answer questions about how to proceed with the separation - I also offered to stay on for 2 weeks to help with the transition if it could be from home and they said that was not an option

review_title: Be ready to pull out some magic
pros: Overall, excellent facilities and lots of catered events throughout the year.
cons:
Overall a toxic work environment where the upper management of the college set their expectations without informing the workforce below them. In my case, resulting in a negative review at the one month mark which claimed I had not met the expectations of the role when the feedback given falls completely outside the job description. 

Beyond that, the day that the college transferred its staff to remote work I was brought into the HR and let go from a salaried position - my manager and HR claiming that there was no work left for me with all in-person activities suspended.

review_title: Great School with Ties to Local Employers
cons: Not a lot of great lunch options nearby.

pros: Flexible hours, conveniently located on campus
cons: Little direction, not that great of pay, employee morale is a bit low
